Rich and all,

A long time ago Tsuruta put one up on the Aoi website. I jum=
ped on it, and
got an email back confirming I had it. The next day I got an=
 apologetic
email saying that when he went to the shop he found it had been=
 sold to a
walk-in customer. So it goes.

A few years ago Andy Quirt had on=
e that is in the Kremmers book, and I had
him send it to me on approval. In=
 addition to the nosebleed price, it just
did not grab me, and I sent it ba=
ck. Bob Haynes later shared with me the
fact that had Kremmers over cleaned=
 all his guards, and that's what had
turned me off without knowing at the t=
ime that was the cause.

I suspect that Yagyu guards - maybe most really gr=
eat guards - change hands
either at the big auction houses or privately.

C=
raig

All, in my few modest y=
ears of collecting, I can't ever remember seeing any
Yagyu school tsuba for=
 sale. I was thinking about this this morning, Are
they quite rare ?, They =
appear in enough books and I really like there
simplistic design. I cannot =
remember ever seeing them on any of the
commercial sites, both Western and =
Japanese, I don't really expect to see
any on Ebay or Bidders.com.

are the=
y that rarely available or have I just missed seeing them.

cheers

Rich
